personalInfo.education: Texas Christian University (2011, Accounting and Finance)

tourBios.curYearHigh: Opened The RSM Classic with a bogey-free 6-under 64 to sit just one stroke behind first-round leader and eventual-champion Kevin Kisner. Closed with a bogey-free 4-under 66 to finish 10-under 272 and T9.
tourBios.carHigh:
2013: Made the cut in eight of 20 Web.com Tour starts, with three top-25 finishes and one top-10...Earned his career-best showing with a runner-up effort at the BMW Charity Pro-Am. Wound up 22-under par in Greenville, five shots back of winner Mark Anderson...Made the cut in two of four Finals' events, a T17 at the Web.com Tour Championship his best outing. 

2012: Made the cut in 13 of 24 starts and recorded a pair of top-10 performances in his first full year on the Web.com Tour...Finished T6 at Pacific Rubiales Colombia Championship in only his second career start on the circuit...In October, finished T8 at the Neediest Kids Championship. Was T4 and two shots back after 36 holes. Trailed Josh Persons by just one stroke after 54 holes but fell back after a 6-over 41 on the back nine left him with a final-round 76 at TPC Potomac at Avenel Farm. 2011: Missed the cut at the WNB Golf Classic, his Web.com Tour debut...Won the Players Cup on the Canadian Tour.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Attended Fargo South High School and was named North Dakota Most Outstanding golfer his senior year...Won the 2010 Western Amateur and was named to the all Mountain West Conference team in 2011. Honorable mention All-American in 2009 and an Academic All-American in 2010 and 2011.
tourBios.personal: Biggest thrill in golf is winning the Canadian Tour's 2011 Players Cup to gain entry into the PGA TOUR's RBC Canadian Open...Never travels without his computer. Favorite college teams are Texas Christian and North Carolina in basketball. Favorite TV show is "Modern Family." Favorite entertainer is Rob Baird. Favorite food is ice cream. Enjoys watching Peyton Manning...Twitter account is @hogegolf...Carries Nature Valley bars in his golf bag...Bucket list is to wear a green jacket.

tourBios.curYrHigh: Opened The RSM Classic with a bogey-free 6-under 64 to sit just one stroke behind first-round leader and eventual-champion Kevin Kisner. Closed with a bogey-free 4-under 66 to finish 10-under 272 and T9.

tourBios.curYearHigh: Opened The RSM Classic with a bogey-free 6-under 64 to sit just one stroke behind first-round leader and eventual-champion Kevin Kisner. Closed with a bogey-free 4-under 66 to finish 10-under 272 and T9.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014-15: Made 15 of 26 cuts during rookie PGA TOUR season, with two top-10s. Finished No. 132 on the FedExCup standings and No. 129 on the money list...Posted four rounds under par, highlighted by a 6-under 66 Sunday, to finish T5 with Stewart Cink at the RBC Canadian Open. Birdied five of his last six holes in the final round at Glen Abbey GC to claim the top-five finish, his career-best...Under the Modified Stableford Format at the Barracuda Championship, finished T10, with 38 points...Held a share of the first- and second-round leads at the Wyndham Championship but finished T38. Was paired with Tiger Woods in the third round, finishing with a 2-over 72...In the Web.com Tour Finals, made the cut in three tournaments. Played his way into contention at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship. Opened with a 1-under 70 and was three back after the first round. Rebounded from a second-round 72 with 70-69 on the weekend to secure a T2 finish, two back of winner Andrew Loupe. Collected a check for $74,666, advancing him to seventh on the Finals' money list, ensuring his return to the PGA TOUR...Did not compete in the Web.com Tour Championship, leaving him 16th on the final priority-ranking order. 2013-14: Played in 24 of the Web.com Tour's 25 tournaments. Had three top-10s and six top-25s, while making 15 cuts...In his first 16 outings, had only two finishes better than 50th, a T12 in Chile in March and a T14 in Wichita in June. Stretch included nine missed cuts, including the last four in late-June and July...First cut made came at the Midwest Classic in July when he made the cut on the number at T61. Vaulted up the leaderboard with a bogey-free 11-under-par 60 in the third round. It was one shot off the Tour's all-time low score of 59, equaled the low round of the year (shared with Zack Sucher at the Albertsons Boise Open and later with Fabian Gomez at the Stonebrae Classic) and tied Scott Dunlap's course record (2011) at Nicklaus GC at LionsGate. The spectacular, yet steady round featured nines of 30-30 and five birdies on each side. The other three rounds were 70-71-71, resulting in a T6 finish, which jumped him from 100th to 75th in earnings...The following week, carded four consecutive rounds in the 60s (66-67-66-65) at the Stonebrae Classic for his second top-10 (T10), moving him another 18 spots up the money list to 57th...Made his next two cuts and finished the Regular Season 65th on the money list...Opened the Web.com Tour Finals with a T53 at the Hotel Fitness Championship, before posting his best finish of the year, a T3, at the Chiquita Classic. A check for $68,000 ensured he would collect his PGA TOUR card for the first time at the close of the Web.com Tour Finals...Made all four cuts in the Finals.

2013: Made the cut in eight of 20 Web.com Tour starts, with three top-25 finishes and one top-10...Earned his career-best showing with a runner-up effort at the BMW Charity Pro-Am. Wound up 22-under par in Greenville, five shots back of winner Mark Anderson...Made the cut in two of four Finals' events, a T17 at the Web.com Tour Championship his best outing. 

2012: Made the cut in 13 of 24 starts and recorded a pair of top-10 performances in his first full year on the Web.com Tour...Finished T6 at Pacific Rubiales Colombia Championship in only his second career start on the circuit...In October, finished T8 at the Neediest Kids Championship. Was T4 and two shots back after 36 holes. Trailed Josh Persons by just one stroke after 54 holes but fell back after a 6-over 41 on the back nine left him with a final-round 76 at TPC Potomac at Avenel Farm. 2011: Missed the cut at the WNB Golf Classic, his Web.com Tour debut...Won the Players Cup on the Canadian Tour. 

Amateur: Attended Fargo South High School and was named North Dakota Most Outstanding golfer his senior year...Won the 2010 Western Amateur and was named to the all Mountain West Conference team in 2011. Honorable mention All-American in 2009 and an Academic All-American in 2010 and 2011.

Enjoys watching Peyton Manning...Twitter account is @hogegolf...Carries Nature Valley bars in his golf bag...Bucket list is to wear a green jacket.

dyn.dynResults: He has finished 9th on the PGA TOUR 2 times in 2016.
